CatDescriptText: W.N. Glanton, insurance agent, Homewood was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "There should be and I feel that there will be an appointment of a Negro to the police inspectorship.  It's essential that such an appointment be made."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.N. Glanton wearing fedora with dark stripe, patterned necktie, and plaid suit standing in front of mosaic tiled building
